I'm Sudarsan

Mechanical/Product Design Engineer with cross-disciplinary strength in robotics, automation, and mechatronics. Passionate about designing future-ready systems.

Experience Projects Skills Contact Me
More About Me

About Me

Hi! I'm Sudarsan Srinivasan, a passionate Mechanical and Product Design Engineer with over 3.5 years of experience in the automotive industry, currently advancing my expertise through a Master's in Mechanical Engineering at the University of Washington.

My core strength lies in combining mechanical design (CAD, DFM/DFA, GD&T, FEA) with cross-disciplinary capabilities in mechatronics, robotics, and automation — building solutions that are not only robust but also intelligent and future-ready.

At Bajaj Auto, I contributed to full-vehicle programs, driving innovations across engine systems, structural components, and cost-saving initiatives. Now, I'm expanding into robotics, control systems, and automation design through projects and research that fuse mechanical engineering with cutting-edge technology.

Core Highlights:

  • Mechanical Design: Siemens NX, SolidWorks, CATIA, DFM/DFA, GD&T
  • Simulation & Analysis: ANSYS, HyperWorks, FEA, DFMEA, DVP
  • Robotics & Controls: MATLAB, Simulink, ROS, Python, C++
  • Quality & Optimization: VAVE, cost reduction, design validation, supplier collaboration

I'm eager to shape the future of mechanical products by blending design excellence with automation intelligence. Let's connect!

Experience

UW BARC — Autonomous Cleaning Bot Project

Robotics Mechatronics Mechanical Design MATLAB & Simulink Control Systems

Graduate Research Project (Jan 2025 – Present) — Developing an automated cleaning robot integrating mechanical design, robotics, and control systems.

Bajaj Auto Limited

Mechanical Design Siemens NX CATIA V5 SolidWorks DFM/DFA & GD&T FEA (ANSYS, HyperView) Root Cause Analysis DFMEA, DVP, DRBFM Supplier Collaboration NXOpen Automation VAVE

Mechanical Design Engineer (Jan 2021 – Jul 2024) — Led mechanical design and quality engineering for ICE/EV platforms in full-vehicle programs (2-wheelers, 3-wheelers, electric vehicles).

Ashok Leyland

Manufacturing Processes Process Optimization Time Studies Quality Control

Manufacturing Engineering Intern (May 2016 – Jul 2016) — Focused on assembly line process optimization and quality improvements.

Rane TRW Steering Systems

Design Engineering CAD Modeling Tolerance Analysis Product Validation

Design Engineering Intern (Jun 2017 – Jul 2017) — Supported steering system component design, validation, and optimization.

Projects

Super Heavy Booster Catch (Demo Only)

Structural analysis Aerodynamic design Propulsion system integration Control Algorithem Welding Metal forming Thermal simulation

(I have never been employed by / affiliated with SpaceX. This is for demo use only) Developing the Super Heavy booster catch project involves designing a robust launch tower with "chopstick" arms, advanced control systems for precise booster alignment, and integrating sophisticated software for real-time trajectory adjustments and structural engineering to handle immense forces.

Safe End-Effector Trajectory Tracking for a 2-DOF Robotic Arm

MATLAB Simulink Control Theory

Designed a CLF-CBF QP controller to ensure safe and stable trajectory tracking under dynamic constraints.

Sonos Teardown

drumel microprobing Electronics Teardown PCB analysis audio system design

Conducted detailed teardown analysis of Sonos Era speaker, documenting internal components, driver configuration, and PCB design. Created technical documentation with photos and assembly insights for engineering reference.
